arm_group.description: Patients with sepsis after PCNL for infectious kidney stone

biospec_descr.textblock:
Peripheral blood sample was collected for detection of neutrophil PD-L1, monocyte HLA-DR and
      lymphocyte PD-1.

brief_summary.textblock:
Immunosuppression is the leading cause of death in septic patients. Neutrophils are
      classical components of innate immunology, but recent studies showed that neutrophils might
      display antigen presenting function and inhibit lymphocyte proliferation by expressing
      programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (PD-L1). Whether neutrophils express PD-L1 and its role in
      immunosuppression during sepsis remain unclear.

clinical_study.brief_title: Expression and the Clinical Significance of Neutrophil PD-L1 During Sepsis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with severe sepsis

          -  patients with sepsis after PCNL for infectious kidney stone

          -  patients with pancreatic cancer

          -  healthy volunteers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with immunodeficient diseases

          -  patients who accept glucocorticoid or immunosuppressant

          -  patients with an age older than 18 years

          -  patients providing the informed consent

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted in ICU at Changhai Hospital

primary_outcome.description: PD-L1 level on neutrophils was compared between different populations.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
